documents.content:
﻿Analytical Data Brief Template

Analytical Data Brief - One Time Purchase

Product Manager 

	Project Lead: Deo Nathaniel

* Good Chop: Deo Nathaniel

* VMS: Wellney Yarra

* Seasonal Boxes: Sameer Doda

	Tech Lead

	Alexander Matlin Jordon Smith

	Analyst

	Alexandra Karathanou

	Status

	In progress

	Launch Date

	Tentative Feature Launch Date

1. Good Chop (US): Sep 2025

2. Seasonal Boxes (Global - start with AU NZ): Oct 2025

3. VMS (US) : Nov 2025

	



________________





Section I 

This section outlines the business problem, the metrics that you need to measure success, and the analytical use cases. This helps analytics and (if needed) data teams understand the details of the problem and evaluate if the existing data assets are sufficient to address the problem or do we need more data. 

1. Business Problem and Feature Overview

HelloFresh Group is addressing key challenges in its business by introducing One-Time-Purchase (OTP) capabilities, moving beyond its traditional subscription-only model. The company recognizes that limited purchasing flexibility has deterred potential new customers and past subscribers who are hesitant about long-term commitments. Furthermore, existing methods for one-off sales, such as those for seasonal boxes, have often relied on separate microsites or legacy internal systems, leading to a fragmented customer experience, operational inefficiencies, and increased costs. This new OTP initiative aims to streamline these processes and capture a wider market by offering greater flexibility, enabling new opportunities like cross-selling Factor meals, integrating Good Chop offerings, and supporting a future two-way marketplace, all while providing a more seamless and intuitive experience for both new and existing customers.





The core of the proposed solution involves creating a unified OTP user flow across HelloFresh Group brands, complete with transparent pricing, distinct cart and checkout processes, and integrated order management for all customer types. Key functionalities to be built include robust SKU management, differentiated menu configurations, automated order confirmations and tracking, and comprehensive backend integration for operations, logistics, and financial reporting. This strategic shift is projected to unlock significant incremental revenue, with estimates ranging from €24.7M to €28.8M in Total Customer Value Added (TCVA), driven by seasonal boxes[a][b] and Good Chop OTP experiments, as well as an anticipated increase in Average Order Value (AOV) from Factor cross-selling. The initiative also focuses on enhancing customer care support for OTP orders[c] and improving data analytics capabilities to monitor performance effectively.





Refer to this doc for product requirements: PRD: Enabling One-Time-Purchase (OTP) Capabilities for HelloFresh Group

Technical Implementation plan: OTP Proposal

2025 OKRs





PACO-NV-5 : Profitably scale Good Chop marketing spend towards $180m ARR by EY 2025

	New Ventures GoC: Drive a cumulative 19% experiment/rollout-driven assumed Gross CR improvements via experiments and rollouts in 2025 for Good Chop

	PACO-RTE-4 : Audience Expansion: New Product segments + Distribution Channels

	VMS: Drive towards achieving 15,690 net conversions for Factor Form by the end of 2025, in alignment with the 2025 business plan.

	



User types:[d][e]

With OTP, we will need to consider different user-subscription types.





Type

	Description

	Logic (Data Alliance)[f][g][h][i]

	Prospect-user[j][k]

	Visitor that lands on landing page

	Customer Table 

Reco



[bn]Hi @ferran.punet@hellofresh.com kind reminder to complete the review the otp success metrics. This will help us move to the next step of planning for making those available.

_Assigned to ferran.punet@hellofresh.com_

[bo]Hi @dvo@hellofresh.com kind reminder to complete the review the otp success metrics. This will help us move to the next step of planning for making those available.

_Assigned to dvo@hellofresh.com_

[bp]thank you for the reminder! just went through it and left a few comments/questions

[bq]HI @sameer.doda@hellofresh.ca kind reminder to complete the review the otp success metrics. This will help us move to the next step of planning for making those available.

_Assigned to sameer.doda@hellofresh.ca_

[br]What FE tracking do we need to determine if someone is an OTP prospect?

[bs]We would need to create a parameter to check if users have an otp order.

[bt]@akar@hellofresh.com I added the OTP order rate here too for visibility, we can remove / rename later. I gave it a new status with 'under review'

_Assigned to akar@hellofresh.com_

[bu]This metric could also apply for reactivations IMO

[bv]Agree

[bw]What's the reason to not combine this with the mac table but stick to the order history table? 

Also, how do we treat users that convert on a subscription but do not end up getting a box? Based on the text here I assume we ignore them but then maybe we could state that in order to graduate to a subscription the user has to have had at least one box on said subscription

[bx]Very good point on empty activations. I will add that we will only count net activations.On the other point you made the tables listed here are to indicate the otp data availability and not how exactly we will calculate the metics. So for this one indeed we can join with mac :)

[by]These metrics can already be calculated using order_line_item table

[bz]Can be calculated already!

[ca]Since it is one-time purchase so what is the point of customer lifetime value

[cb]what cadence should we send when the user selects one time box? cadence is used for subscriptions only

[cc]Hi @crui@hellofresh.com will we have the delivery handle at this stage? Or is it related to address?

[cd]@akar@hellofresh.com can you help specify all of the events we need to add the box_type parameter? We need it to implement

[ce]@wellney.yarra@hellofresh.com

[cf]@wellney.yarra@hellofresh.com

documents.title: Factor Form | One Time Purchase
documents.content:
﻿4 customer questions

1. Who is the primary customer?  

Factor Form prospective customers who are interested in trying out the products but not interested in committing to a subscription for various reasons: 

* Want to trial products before committing to a subscription

* Prefer purchasing supplements as needed rather than on a recurring basis

* Are hesitant about subscription commitments due to past negative experiences

* Have irregular supplement consumption patterns

2. What is the customer problem or opportunity? 

Most consumers in the US still tend to approach supplement purchases with more flexibility, buying products on an as-needed basis. Nearly half of Gen Z (49%) and more than half of Millennials (53%) buy supplements when required, 58% of Gen X and 57% of Baby Boomers. 



As of today, Factor Form is only available as a subscription. As a result, we are not serving the needs of most of our target customers, or force them into a subscription only for them to cancel later on. 

13.3% of Factor Form customers cancel due to having excess product, another 9.4% cancel due to delivery frequency.





3. What is the solution? What is the customer experience? 

Every product offered on Factor Form will be available for purchase as a subscription as well as a one-time purchase. We will position subscriptions first and offer them at a lower price, as we would like to incentivize customers to stick to the habit in order to see results from the products and stay for subsequent orders. However, one-time purchase will still be available for customers who prioritize their flexibility, albeit at a higher price.

4. What is the most important customer benefit?  

The ability to buy Factor Form products without committing to a subscription or worrying about getting unwanted orders. 













PRD

[PRD] Factor Form | One-Time Purchase Option





Last updated: Jun 10, 2025

Author: Wellney Yarra

Status: Ready for stakeholder feedback and project kick off

Context





Factor Form currently operates on a subscription-only model. This PRD outlines the requirements for introducing one-time purchase options to expand our total addressable market (TAM) and capture customers who prefer transactional purchases over recurring subscriptions.





The current subscription-only model creates barriers for potential customers who:

* Want to trial products before committing to a subscription

* Prefer purchasing supplements as needed rather than on a recurring basis

* Are hesitant about subscription commitments due to past negative experiences

* Have irregular supplement consumption patterns





This limitation reduces our market penetration and customer acquisition potential in the growing supplement market.





Opportunity





The global dietary supplements market is valued at over $150 billion, with over 50% of consumers preferring one-time purchases for product trials and flexibility. By offering one-time purchases, we can:

- Increase conversion rates from prospects to customers

- Capture market share from competitors offering flexible purchase options

- Generate incremental revenue from existing customers making additional purchases

- Reduce customer acquisition friction and expand our funnel





Success Metrics

* Revenue impact: 15% increase in total Factor For
